title: Phone number
description: Information that enables the contact of a person with a phone. Typically an alphanumeric number, 1-222-333-4444 in North America, but can have a wide range of formats.

primary.title: Primary
primary.description: Primary phone number indicator. Unlike address or email address, there can be multiple primary phone numbers; one per communication channel. The communication channel is defined by the type: `textMessaging`, `mobile`, `phone`, `home`, `work`, `unknown`, and `fax`.

number.title: Number
number.description: The phone number. Note the phone number is a string and may include meaningful characters such as brackets '()', hyphens '-', or characters to indicate sub-dialing identifiers like extensions 'x' for example,  1-353(0)18391111 or +613 9403600x1234.

extension.title: Extension
extension.description: The internal dialing number used to call from a private exchange, operator, or switchboard.

status.title: Status
status.description: An indication as to the ability to use the phone number.

statusReason.title: Status reason
statusReason.description: A description of the current status.

validity.title: Validity
validity.description: A level of technical correctness of the phone number.
